The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd.

type: (n : ℕ) → Finset (Nat.Partition n)
name: Nat.Partition.odds
docString: The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd.

A natural number is odd if and only if it is not even, or equivalently, a natural number is odd if and only if it can be expressed as 2 times an integer plus one, while an even number can be expressed as the sum of two integers.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, Odd n ↔ ¬Even n
name: Nat.odd_iff_not_even
docString: A natural number is odd if and only if it is not even, or equivalently, a natural number is odd if and only if it can be expressed as 2 times an integer plus one, while an even number can be expressed as the sum of two integers.

This theorem states that a natural number is odd if and only if its remainder when divided by 4 is either 1 or 3. In other words, it characterizes odd numbers in terms of their residues modulo 4.

name: Nat.odd_mod_four_iff
docString: This theorem states that a natural number is odd if and only if its remainder when divided by 4 is either 1 or 3. In other words, it characterizes odd numbers in terms of their residues modulo 4.

For every natural number `n`, the oddness of `n` and `n+1` are opposite.

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), n.succ.bodd = !n.bodd
name: Nat.bodd_succ
docString: For every natural number `n`, the oddness of `n` and `n+1` are opposite.

This theorem states that for any natural number `n`, if the remainder when `n` is divided by 4 equals 1 then the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 also equals 1. In other words, if a natural number is one more than a multiple of 4, then it is an odd number.

name: Nat.odd_of_mod_four_eq_one
docString: This theorem states that for any natural number `n`, if the remainder when `n` is divided by 4 equals 1 then the remainder when `n` is divided by 2 also equals 1. In other words, if a natural number is one more than a multiple of 4, then it is an odd number.

The finset of those partitions in which every part is odd and used at most once.

**Lifting the exponent lemma** for odd primes.

type:
∀ {p : ℕ},
  Nat.Prime p →
    Odd p →
      ∀ {x y : ℤ},
        ↑p ∣ x - y →
          ¬↑p ∣ x → ∀ (n : ℕ), multiplicity (↑p) (x ^ n - y ^ n) = multiplicity (↑p) (x - y) + multiplicity p n
name: multiplicity.Int.pow_sub_pow
docString: **Lifting the exponent lemma** for odd primes.
